thread.title: Mark Ingram, other Saints players deemed 'too urban' for entry to London club
thread.title_full: Mark Ingram, other Saints players deemed 'too urban' for entry to London club

author: Ron Clements (us-editorial@performgroup.com)
title: Mark Ingram, other Saints players deemed 'too urban' for entry to London club
text:
36pm  19pm EST American Football, News, English, Mark Ingram, Sterling Moore, NFL, New Orleans Saints Ingram said he and some Saints teammates were turned away from a circus-themed nightclub for being "too urban." Mark Ingram (Getty Images) 
Updated at 11:36  36 p.m. ET 
The Saints and Dolphins will play in London on Oct. 1. 
A few Saints players, including running back Mark Ingram, cornerbacks Sterling Moore and B.W. Webb, and safety Vonn Bell, traveled to England'sÂ capital city to check things out this week. 
Ingram tweeted that they had a great time , with the exception of being turned away from a circus-themed night club called Cirque Le Soir because the group of black football players looked "too urban," Ingram said.Â They told us they were "6 big guys" that are too "Urban" but nobody taller than 5'11!! đđđ¤đ¤ cc:saints roster đđđđ â Mark Ingram II (@MarkIngram22) February 28, 2017 
Ingram, the 2009 Heisman Trophy winner from Alabama, is 5-10, as is Moore. Webb and Bell are each 5-11.Â
